author: Special Correspondent
text:
The need for Information Technology professional developing communication skills was stressed by experts in the field of IT at a career development programme held at the Excel Group of Institutions, Komarapalayam, recently.

Pattabiraman Krishnaswamy, head-accreditation process for South India, Tata Consultancy Services, urged the students to develop an agenda for their own growth and for the development of society.

They should spend time, energy and money as an investment to learn how to develop knowledge and how to create a safer and brighter future. He urged the younger generation to concentrate in learning other languages.

Veerendra Pratap, senior manager, Wipro Technologies Limited, Bengaluru, said that communication played a very vital role in the IT industry.

The IT students should develop their ability of communicating in a language which the customer preferred.

New students should understand the psychology of the management and administrators so that they can provide their best according to their expectations, he said.

Savitha R. Ganjigatti, T.K. Dinesh Kumar, director, HR, Aspire systems, too handled separate sessions.
title: Call to develop communication skills
